member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetOption and IQueryParser::GetOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Schema
member.summary: The value should be VT_LPWSTR and the path to a file containing a schema binary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Locale
member.summary: The value must be VT_EMPTY (the default) or a VT_UI4 that is an LCID. It is used as the locale of contents (not keywords) in the query to be searched for, when no other information is available. The default value is the current keyboard locale. Retrieving the value always returns a VT_UI4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.WordBreaker
member.summary: This option is used to override the default word breaker used when identifying keywords in queries. The default word breaker is chosen according to the language of the keywords (cf. SQSO_LANGUAGE_KEYWORDS below). When setting this option, the value should be VT_EMPTY for using the default word breaker, or a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.NaturalSyntax
member.summary: The value should be VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to allow natural query syntax (the default) or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to allow only advanced query syntax. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL. This option is now deprecated, use SQSO_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.AutomaticWildcard
member.summary: The value should be VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to generate query expressions as if each word in the query had a star appended to it (unless followed by punctuation other than a parenthesis), or VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to use the words as they are (the default). A word-wheeling application will generally want to set this option to true. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TraceLevel
member.summary: Reserved. The value should be VT_EMPTY (the default) or VT_I4. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_I4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.LanguageKeywords
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a LANGID. It defaults to the default user UI language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Syntax
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a STRUCTURED_QUERY_SYNTAX value. It defaults to SQS_NATURAL_QUERY_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TimeZone
member.summary: The value must be a VT_BLOB that is a copy of a TIME_ZONE_INFORMATION structure. It defaults to the current time zone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ImplicitConnector
member.summary: This setting decides what connector should be assumed between conditions when none is specified. The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CONDITION_TYPE. Only CT_AND_CONDITION and CT_OR_CONDITION are valid. It defaults to CT_AND_CONDITION.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ConnectorCase
member.summary: This setting decides whether there are special requirements on the case of connector keywords (such as AND or OR). The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CASE_REQUIREMENT value. It defaults to CASE_REQUIREMENT_UPPER_IF_AQS.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetMultiOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.VirtualProperty
member.summary: The key should be property name P. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with an IEnumVARIANT which has two values: a VT_BSTR that is another property name Q and a VT_I4 that is a CONDITION_OPERATION cop. A predicate with property name P, some operation and a value V will then be replaced by a predicate with property name Q, operation cop and value V before further processing happens.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.DefaultProperty
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_LPWSTR with a property name P. A predicate with no property name and a value of type V (or any subtype of V) will then use property P.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.GeneratorForType
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with a IConditionGenerator G. The GenerateForLeaf method of G will then be applied to any predicate with value type V and if it returns a query expression, that will be used. If it returns NULL, normal processing will be used instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.MapProperty
member.summary: The key should be a property name P. The value should be a VT_VECTOR|VT_LPWSTR, where each string is a property name. The count must be at least one. This "map" will be added to those of the loaded schema and used during resolution. A second call with the same key will replace the current map. If the value is VT_NULL, the map will be removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption
member.summary: Used by IQueryParserManager::SetOption to set parsing options. This can be used to specify schemas and localization options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.SchemaBinaryName
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the name of the file that contains the schema binary. The default value is StructuredQuerySchema.bin for the SystemIndex catalog and StructuredQuerySchemaTrivial.bin for the trivial catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.PreLocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: Either a VT_BOOL or a VT_LPWSTR. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is FALSE, a pre-localized schema will not be used. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is TRUE, IQueryParserManager will use the pre-localized schema binary in "%ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Microsoft\Windows". If the value is a VT_LPWSTR, the value should contain the full path of the folder in which the pre-localized schema binary can be found. The default value is VT_BOOL with TRUE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.UnlocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the unlocalized schema binary. The default value is "%SYSTEMROOT%\System32".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the localized schema binary that can be read and written to as needed. The default value is "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.AppendLCIDToLocalizedPath
member.summary: A VT_BOOL. If TRUE, then the paths for pre-localized and localized binaries have "\(LCID)" appended to them, where language code identifier (LCID) is the decimal locale ID for the localized language. The default is TRUE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizerSupport
member.summary: A VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting ISchemaLocalizerSupport. This object will be used instead of the default localizer support object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnail.RetrievalOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the current retrieval option is cache or extract, cache only, or from memory only. The default is cache or extract.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnail.FormatOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the current format option is thumbnail or icon, thumbnail only, or icon only. The default is thumbnail or icon.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnail.AllowBiggerSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the user can manually stretch the returned image. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For example, if the caller passes in 80x80 a 96x96 thumbnail could be returned. This could be used as a performance optimization if the caller will need to stretch the image themselves anyway. Note that the Shell implementation performs a GDI stretch blit. If the caller wants a higher quality image stretch, they should pass this flag and do it themselves.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption
member.summary: Represents the different retrieval options for the thumbnail or icon, such as extracting the thumbnail or icon from a file, from the cache only, or from memory only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.Default
member.summary: The default behavior loads a thumbnail. If there is no thumbnail for the current ShellItem, the icon is retrieved. The thumbnail or icon is extracted if it is not currently cached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.CacheOnly
member.summary: The CacheOnly behavior returns a cached thumbnail if it is available. Allows access to the disk, but only to retrieve a cached item. If no cached thumbnail is available, a cached per-instance icon is returned but a thumbnail or icon is not extracted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.MemoryOnly
member.summary: The MemoryOnly behavior returns the item only if it is in memory. The disk is not accessed even if the item is cached. Note that this only returns an already-cached icon and can fall back to a per-class icon if an item has a per-instance icon that has not been cached yet. Retrieving a thumbnail, even if it is cached, always requires the disk to be accessed, so this method should not be called from the user interface (UI) thread without passing ShellThumbnailCacheOptions.MemoryOnly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption
member.summary: Represents the format options for the thumbnails and icons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.Default
member.summary: The default behavior loads a thumbnail. An HBITMAP for the icon of the item is retrieved if there is no thumbnail for the current Shell Item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.ThumbnailOnly
member.summary: The ThumbnailOnly behavior returns only the thumbnails, never the icon. Note that not all items have thumbnails so ShellThumbnailFormatOption.ThumbnailOnly can fail in these cases.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.IconOnly
member.summary: The IconOnly behavior returns only the icon, never the thumbnail.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions
member.summary: Indicate flags that modify the property store object retrieved by methods that create a property store, such as IShellItem2::GetPropertyStore or IPropertyStoreFactory::GetPropertyStore.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.Default
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Return a read-only property store that contains all properties. Slow items (offline files) are not opened. Combination with other flags: Can be overridden by other flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.HandlePropertiesOnly
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Include only properties directly from the property handler, which opens the file on the disk, network, or device. Meaning to a file folder: Only include properties directly from the handler.
Meaning to other folders: When delegating to a file folder, pass this flag on to the file folder; do not do any multiplexing (MUX). When not delegating to a file folder, ignore this flag instead of returning a failure code.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY, or GPS_BESTEFFORT.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.ReadWrite
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Can write properties to the item. Note: The store may contain fewer properties than a read-only store.
Meaning to a file folder: ReadWrite.
Meaning to other folders: ReadWrite. Note: When using default MUX, return a single unmultiplexed store because the default MUX does not support ReadWrite.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY, GPS_BESTEFFORT, or GPS_DELAYCREATION. Implies GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.Temporary
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Provides a writable store, with no initial properties, that exists for the lifetime of the Shell item instance; basically, a property bag attached to the item instance.
Meaning to a file folder: Not applicable. Handled by the Shell item.
Meaning to other folders: Not applicable. Handled by the Shell item.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with any other flag. Implies GPS_READWRITE

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.FastPropertiesOnly
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Provides a store that does not involve reading from the disk or network. Note: Some values may be different, or missing, compared to a store without this flag.
Meaning to a file folder: Include the "innate" and "fallback" stores only. Do not load the handler.
Meaning to other folders: Include only properties that are available in memory or can be computed very quickly (no properties from disk, network, or peripheral IO devices). This is normally only data sources from the IDLIST. When delegating to other folders, pass this flag on to them.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_READWRITE, GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY, or GPS_DELAYCREATION.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.OpensLowItem
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Open a slow item (offline file) if necessary. Meaning to a file folder: Retrieve a file from offline storage, if necessary. Note: Without this flag, the handler is not created for offline files.
Meaning to other folders: Do not return any properties that are very slow.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY or GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.DelayCreation
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Delay memory-intensive operations, such as file access, until a property is requested that requires such access.
Meaning to a file folder: Do not create the handler until needed; for example, either GetCount/GetAt or GetValue, where the innate store does not satisfy the request. Note: GetValue might fail due to file access problems.
Meaning to other folders: If the folder has memory-intensive properties, such as delegating to a file folder or network access, it can optimize performance by supporting IDelayedPropertyStoreFactory and splitting up its properties into a fast and a slow store. It can then use delayed MUX to recombine them.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY or GPS_READWRITE

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.BestEffort
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Succeed at getting the store, even if some properties are not returned. Note: Some values may be different, or missing, compared to a store without this flag.
Meaning to a file folder: Succeed and return a store, even if the handler or innate store has an error during creation. Only fail if substores fail.
Meaning to other folders: Succeed on getting the store, even if some properties are not returned.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_READWRITE, or GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.MaskValid
member.summary: Mask for valid GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.CanCopy
member.summary: The specified items can be copied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.CanLink
member.summary: Shortcuts can be created for the specified items. This flag has the same value as DROPEFFECT. The normal use of this flag is to add a Create Shortcut item to the shortcut menu that is displayed during drag-and-drop operations. However, SFGAO_CANLINK also adds a Create Shortcut item to the Microsoft Windows Explorer's File menu and to normal shortcut menus. If this item is selected, your application's IContextMenu::InvokeCommand is invoked with the lpVerb member of the CMINVOKECOMMANDINFO structure set to "link." Your application is responsible for creating the link.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.FileSystem
member.summary: The specified folders or file objects are part of the file system that is, they are files, directories, or root directories).

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.HasSubFolder
member.summary: The specified folders have subfolders = and are, therefore, expandable in the left pane of Windows Explorer).

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.ContentsMask

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Validate
member.summary: When specified as input, SFGAO_VALIDATE instructs the folder to validate that the items pointed to by the contents of apidl exist. If one or more of those items do not exist, IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf returns a failure code. When used with the file system folder, SFGAO_VALIDATE instructs the folder to discard cached properties retrieved by clients of IShellFolder2::GetDetailsEx that may have accumulated for the specified items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Removable

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Browsable

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Nonenumerated
member.summary: The items are nonenumerated items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.NewContent
member.summary: The objects contain new content.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.CanMoniker

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.PkeyMask

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes
member.summary:
The STGM constants are flags that indicate conditions for creating and deleting the object and access modes for the object.
You can combine these flags, but you can only choose one flag from each group of related flags. Typically one flag from each of the access and sharing groups must be specified for all functions and methods which use these constants.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Direct
member.summary: Indicates that, in direct mode, each change to a storage or stream element is written as it occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Transacted
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, changes are buffered and written only if an explicit commit operation is called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Simple
member.summary: Provides a faster implementation of a compound file in a limited, but frequently used, case.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Read
member.summary: Indicates that the object is read-only, meaning that modifications cannot be made.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Write
member.summary: Enables you to save changes to the object, but does not permit access to its data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ReadWrite
member.summary: Enables access and modification of object data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyNone
member.summary: Specifies that subsequent openings of the object are not denied read or write access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyRead
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in Read mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyWrite
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object for Write or ReadWrite access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.ShareExclusive
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in any mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Priority
member.summary: Opens the storage object with exclusive access to the most recently committed version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.DeleteOnRelease
member.summary: Indicates that the underlying file is to be automatically destroyed when the root storage object is released. This feature is most useful for creating temporary files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.NoScratch
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, a temporary scratch file is usually used to save modifications until the Commit method is called. Specifying NoScratch permits the unused portion of the original file to be used as work space instead of creating a new file for that purpose.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Create
member.summary: Indicates that an existing storage object or stream should be removed before the new object replaces it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.Convert
member.summary: Creates the new object while preserving existing data in a stream named "Contents".

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.FailIfThere
member.summary: Causes the create operation to fail if an existing object with the specified name exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.NoSnapshot
member.summary: This flag is used when opening a storage object with Transacted and without ShareExclusive or ShareDenyWrite. In this case, specifying NoSnapshot prevents the system-provided implementation from creating a snapshot copy of the file. Instead, changes to the file are written to the end of the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.AccessModes.DirectSingleWriterMultipleReader
member.summary: Supports direct mode for single-writer, multireader file operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Border
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Caption
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Child
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.ChildWindow
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.ClipChildren
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.ClipSiblings
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Disabled
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.DialogFrame
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Group
member.summary:
The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.
You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.HorizontalScroll
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Iconic
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_MINIMIZE style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Maximize
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.MaximizeBox
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specifie

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Minimize
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.MinimizeBox
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Overlapped
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Popup
member.summary: The windows is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.SizeBox
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_THICKFRAME style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.SystemMenu
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Tabstop
member.summary:
The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style.
You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.ThickFrame
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Tiled
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPED style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.Visible
member.summary:
The window is initially visible.
This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.VerticalScroll
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.TiledWindowMask
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.PopupWindowMask
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.WindowStyles.OverlappedWindowMask
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the WS_TILEDWINDOW style.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory
member.summary: Specifies the categories for known folders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.None
member.summary: The folder category is not specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.Virtual
member.summary: The folder is a virtual folder. Virtual folders are not part of the file system. For example, Control Panel and Printers are virtual folders. A number of properties such as folder path and redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.Fixed
member.summary: The folder is fixed. Fixed file system folders are not managed by the Shell and are usually given a permanent path when the system is installed. For example, the Windows and Program Files folders are fixed folders. A number of properties such as redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.Common
member.summary: The folder is a common folder. Common folders are used for sharing data and settings accessible by all users of a system. For example, all users share a common Documents folder as well as their per-user Documents folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderCategory.PerUser
member.summary: Each user has their own copy of the folder. Per-user folders are those stored under each user's profile and accessible only by that user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderProperties
member.summary: Structure used internally to store property values for a known folder. This structure holds the information returned in the FOLDER_DEFINITION structure, and resources referenced by fields in NativeFolderDefinition, such as icon and tool tip.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes
member.summary: The FolderTypes values represent a view template applied to a folder, usually based on its intended use and contents.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.NotSpecified
member.summary: No particular content type has been detected or specified. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Invalid
member.summary: The folder is invalid. There are several things that can cause this judgement: hard disk errors, file system errors, and compression errors among them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Documents
member.summary: The folder contains document files. These can be of mixed format.doc, .txt, and others.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Pictures
member.summary: Image files, such as .jpg, .tif, or .png files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Music
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains audio files, such as .mp3 and .wma files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.MusicIcons
member.summary: A list of music files displayed in Icons view. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Games
member.summary: The folder is the Games folder found in the Start menu.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.ControlPanelCategory
member.summary: The Control Panel in category view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.ControlPanelClassic
member.summary: The Control Panel in classic view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Printers
member.summary: Printers that have been added to the system. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.RecycleBin
member.summary: The Recycle Bin. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.SoftwareExplorer
member.summary: The software explorer window used by the Add or Remove Programs control panel icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.CompressedFolder
member.summary: The folder is a compressed archive, such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Contacts
member.summary: An e-mail-related folder that contains contact information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Library
member.summary: A default library view without a more specific template. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.NetworkExplorer
member.summary: The Network Explorer folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.UserFiles
member.summary: The folder is the FOLDERID_UsersFiles folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.GenericSearchResults
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains search results, but they are of mixed or no specific type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.GenericLibrary
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder is a library, but of no specified type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Videos
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains video files. These can be of mixed format.wmv, .mov, and others.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.UsersLibraries
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The view shown when the user clicks the Windows Explorer button on the taskbar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.OtherUsers
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The homegroup view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Communications
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. A folder that contains communication-related files such as e-mails, calendar information, and contact information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.RecordedTV
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains recorded television broadcasts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.SavedGames
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains saved game states.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.OpenSearch
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains federated search OpenSearch results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.SearchConnector
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Before you search.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.FolderTypes.Searches
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. A user's Searches folder, normally found at C:\Users\username\Searches.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper
member.summary: Creates the helper class for known folders.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromPIDL(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the native known folder (IKnownFolderNative) given a PID list

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromKnownFolderId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given a globally unique identifier.
member.param: A GUID for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given Known Folder ID is invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromKnownFolderIdInternal(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given a globally unique identifier.
member.param: A GUID for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name. Returns null if Known Folder is not found or could not be created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.GetKnownFolder(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.IKnownFolderNative)
member.summary: Given a native KnownFolder (IKnownFolderNative), create the right type of IKnownFolder object (FileSystemKnownFolder or NonFileSystemKnownFolder)

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromCanonicalName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the known folder given its canonical name.
member.param: A non-localized canonical name for the known folder, such as MyComputer.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given canonical name is invalid or if the KnownFolder could not be created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given its shell path, such as C:\users\public\documents or ::{645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E} for the Recycle Bin.
member.param: The path for the requested known folder; either a physical path or a virtual path.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromParsingName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given its shell namespace parsing name, such as ::{645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E} for the Recycle Bin.
member.param: The parsing name (or path) for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given parsing name is invalid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectWatcher
member.summary: Listens for changes in/on a ShellObject and raises events when they occur. This class supports all items under the shell namespace including files, folders and virtual folders (libraries, search results and network items), etc.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectWatcher.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the ShellObjectWatcher for the given ShellObject
member.param: Whether to listen for changes recursively (for when monitoring a container)

member.summary: Gets whether the watcher is currently running.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectWatcher.Start
member.summary:
Start the watcher and begin receiving change notifications.
If the watcher is running, has no effect. Registration for notifications should be done before this is called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectWatcher.Stop
member.summary: Stop the watcher and prevent further notifications from being received. If the watcher is not running, this has no effect.

member.summary: Processes all change notifications sent by the Windows Shell.
member.param: The windows message representing the notification event

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes
member.summary: Describes the event that has occurred. Typically, only one event is specified at a time. If more than one event is specified, the values contained in the dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters must be the same, respectively, for all specified events. This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.ItemRename
member.summary: The name of a nonfolder item has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the previous PIDL or name of the item. dwItem2 contains the new PIDL or name of the item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.ItemCreate
member.summary: A nonfolder item has been created. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that was created. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.ItemDelete
member.summary: A nonfolder item has been deleted. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that was deleted. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DirectoryCreate
member.summary: A folder has been created. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that was created. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DirectoryDelete
member.summary: A folder has been removed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.MediaInsert
member.summary: Storage media has been inserted into a drive. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that contains the new media. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.MediaRemove
member.summary: Storage media has been removed from a drive. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive from which the media was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DriveRemove
member.summary: A drive has been removed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DriveAdd
member.summary: A drive has been added. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was added. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.NetShare
member.summary: A folder on the local computer is being shared via the network. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that is being shared. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.NetUnshare
member.summary: A folder on the local computer is no longer being shared via the network. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that is no longer being shared. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.AttributesChange
member.summary: The attributes of an item or folder have changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item or folder that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DirectoryContentsUpdate
member.summary: The contents of an existing folder have changed, but the folder still exists and has not been renamed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL. If a folder has been created, deleted, or renamed, use SHCNE_MKDIR, SHCNE_RMDIR, or SHCNE_RENAMEFOLDER, respectively.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.Update
member.summary: An existing item (a folder or a nonfolder) has changed, but the item still exists and has not been renamed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL. If a nonfolder item has been created, deleted, or renamed, use SHCNE_CREATE, SHCNE_DELETE, or SHCNE_RENAMEITEM, respectively, instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.ServerDisconnect
member.summary: The computer has disconnected from a server. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the server from which the computer was disconnected. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

members.member: An image in the system image list has changed. SHCNF_DWORD must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 is not used and should be NULL. dwItem2 contains the index in the system image list that has changed. //verify this is not opposite?

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DirectoryRename
member.summary: The name of a folder has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the previous PIDL or name of the folder. dwItem2 contains the new PIDL or name of the folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.FreeSpace
member.summary: The amount of free space on a drive has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive on which the free space changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.AssociationChange
member.summary: A file type association has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST must be specified in the uFlags parameter. dwItem1 and dwItem2 are not used and must be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DiskEventsMask
member.summary: Specifies a combination of all of the disk event identifiers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.GlobalEventsMask
member.summary: Specifies a combination of all of the global event identifiers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.AllEventsMask
member.summary: All events have occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.FromInterrupt
member.summary: The specified event occurred as a result of a system interrupt. As this value modifies other event values, it cannot be used alone.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.Initialize(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.NativeRect@,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Controls.FolderSettings)
member.summary: Prepares the browser to be navigated.
member.param: A handle to the owner window or control.

A pointer to a RECT containing the coordinates of the bounding rectangle the browser will occupy. The coordinates are relative to hwndParent. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetRect should subsequently be called.

A pointer to a FOLDERSETTINGS structure that determines how the folder will be displayed in the view. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetFolderSettings should be called, otherwise, the default view settings for the folder are used.

member.param: A pointer to a DeferWindowPos handle. This paramater can be NULL.
The coordinates that the browser will occupy.

If called with True, the method will call DwmSetWindowAttribute for the specific window handle and let DWM know that we will be providing a custom bitmap for the thumbnail as well as Aero peek.

member.summary: Represents an instance of a Taskbar button jump list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.JumpList.CreateJumpList
member.summary: Create a JumpList for the application's taskbar button.
member.returns: A new JumpList that is associated with the app id of the main application window
member.remarks: If there are any other child (top-level) windows for this application and they don't have a specific JumpList created for them, they all will share the same JumpList as the main application window. In order to have a individual JumpList for a top-level window, use the overloaded method CreateJumpListForIndividualWindow.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.JumpList.CreateJumpListForIndividualWindow(System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Create a JumpList for the application's taskbar button.
member.param: Application Id for the individual window. This must be unique for each top-level window in order to have a individual JumpList.
Handle of the window associated with the new JumpList
member.returns: A new JumpList that is associated with the specific window handle

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.JumpList.CreateJumpListForIndividualWindow(System.String,System.Windows.Window)
member.summary: Create a JumpList for the application's taskbar button.
member.param: Application Id for the individual window. This must be unique for each top-level window in order to have a individual JumpList.
WPF Window associated with the new JumpList
member.returns: A new JumpList that is associated with the specific WPF window

member.summary: Removes all user tasks that have been added.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.JumpList.MaxSlotsInList
member.summary: Gets the recommended number of items to add to the jump list.
member.remarks: This number doesnt imply or suggest how many items will appear on the jump list. This number should only be used for reference purposes since the actual number of slots in the jump list can change after the last refresh due to items being pinned or removed and resolution changes. The jump list can increase in size accordingly.

member.param: Window handle of the parent window. This window has to be a top-level window and the handle cannot be null or IntPtr.Zero
Window handle of the child control or window for which a tabbed thumbnail needs to be displayed

member.param: Window handle of the parent window. This window has to be a top-level window and the handle cannot be null or IntPtr.Zero
Child control for which a tabbed thumbnail needs to be displayed
member.remarks: This method can also be called when using a WindowsFormHost control in a WPF application. Call this method with the main WPF Window's handle, and windowsFormHost.Child control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.#ctor(System.Windows.Window,System.Windows.UIElement,System.Windows.Vector)
member.summary: Creates a new TabbedThumbnail with the given window handle of the parent and a WPF child Window. For WindowsFormHost control, use TabbedThumbnail(IntPtr, Control) overload and pass the WindowsFormHost.Child as the second parameter.

WPF Control (UIElement) for which a tabbed thumbnail needs to be displayed
Offset point used for displaying the peek bitmap. This setting is recomended for hidden WPF controls as it is difficult to calculate their offset.

member.summary: Sets the window icon for this thumbnail preview

member.remarks: This method will not release the icon handle. It is the caller's responsibility to release the icon handle.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.ClippingRectangle
member.summary:
Specifies that only a portion of the window's client area should be used in the window's thumbnail.
A value of null will clear the clipping area and use the default thumbnail.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.SetImage(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Override the thumbnail and peek bitmap. By providing this bitmap manually, Thumbnail Window manager will provide the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) this bitmap instead of rendering one automatically. Use this property to update the bitmap whenever the control is updated and the user needs to be shown a new thumbnail on the taskbar preview (or aero peek).
member.remarks: If the bitmap doesn't have the right dimensions, the DWM may scale it or not render certain areas as appropriate - it is the user's responsibility to render a bitmap with the proper dimensions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.SetImage(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource)
member.summary: Override the thumbnail and peek bitmap. By providing this bitmap manually, Thumbnail Window manager will provide the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) this bitmap instead of rendering one automatically. Use this property to update the bitmap whenever the control is updated and the user needs to be shown a new thumbnail on the taskbar preview (or aero peek).
member.remarks: If the bitmap doesn't have the right dimensions, the DWM may scale it or not render certain areas as appropriate - it is the user's responsibility to render a bitmap with the proper dimensions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.SetImage(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Override the thumbnail and peek bitmap. By providing this bitmap manually, Thumbnail Window manager will provide the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) this bitmap instead of rendering one automatically. Use this property to update the bitmap whenever the control is updated and the user needs to be shown a new thumbnail on the taskbar preview (or aero peek).
member.param:
A bitmap handle for the image to use.
When the TabbedThumbnail is finalized, this class will delete the provided hBitmap.
member.remarks: If the bitmap doesn't have the right dimensions, the DWM may scale it or not render certain areas as appropriate - it is the user's responsibility to render a bitmap with the proper dimensions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.DisplayFrameAroundBitmap
member.summary: Specifies whether a standard window frame will be displayed around the bitmap. If the bitmap represents a top-level window, you would probably set this flag to true. If the bitmap represents a child window (or a frameless window), you would probably set this flag to false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.InvalidatePreview
member.summary: Invalidate any existing thumbnail preview. Calling this method will force DWM to request a new bitmap next time user previews the thumbnails or requests Aero peek preview.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.PeekOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset used for displaying the peek bitmap. This setting is recomended for hidden WPF controls as it is difficult to calculate their offset.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnailManager.InvalidateThumbnails
member.summary: Invalidates all the tabbed thumbnails. This will force the Desktop Window Manager to not use the cached thumbnail or preview or aero peek and request a new one next time.
member.remarks: This method should not be called frequently. Doing so can lead to poor performance as new bitmaps are created and retrieved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnailManager.ClearThumbnailClip(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Clear a clip that is already in place and return to the default display of the thumbnail.
member.param: The handle to a window represented in the taskbar. This has to be a top-level window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnailManager.SetThumbnailClip(System.IntPtr,System.Nullable{System.Drawing.Rectangle})
member.summary: Selects a portion of a window's client area to display as that window's thumbnail in the taskbar.
member.param: The handle to a window represented in the taskbar. This has to be a top-level window.

Rectangle structure that specifies a selection within the window's client area, relative to the upper-left corner of that client area.
If this parameter is null, the clipping area will be cleared and the default display of the thumbnail will be used instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnailManager.SetTabOrder(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail)
member.summary: Moves an existing thumbnail to a new position in the application's group.
member.param: Preview for the window whose order is being changed. This value is required, must already be added via AddThumbnailPreview method, and cannot be null.

The preview of the tab window whose thumbnail that previewToChange is inserted to the left of. This preview must already be added via AddThumbnailPreview. If this value is null, the previewToChange tab is added to the end of the list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.TaskbarManager.SetApplicationIdForSpecificWindow(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the application user model id for an individual window
member.param: Window handle for the window that needs a specific application id
member.remarks: AppId specifies a unique Application User Model ID (AppID) for the application or individual top-level window whose taskbar button will hold the custom JumpList built through the methods class. By setting an appId for a specific window, the window will not be grouped with it's parent window/application. Instead it will have it's own taskbar button.

By setting an appId for a specific window, the window will not be grouped with it's parent window/application. Instead it will have it's own taskbar button.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarManager.AddButtons(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarButton[])
member.summary: Adds thumbnail toolbar for the specified window.
member.param: Window handle for which the thumbnail toolbar buttons need to be added
Thumbnail buttons for the window's thumbnail toolbar
member.exception: If the number of buttons exceed the maximum allowed capacity (7).
If the Window Handle passed in invalid
member.remarks: After a toolbar has been added to a thumbnail, buttons can be altered only through various properties on the . While individual buttons cannot be added or removed, they can be shown and hidden through as needed. The toolbar itself cannot be removed without re-creating the window itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarManager.AddButtons(System.Windows.UIElement,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarButton[])
member.summary: Adds thumbnail toolbar for the specified WPF Control.
member.param: WPF Control for which the thumbnail toolbar buttons need to be added
Thumbnail buttons for the window's thumbnail toolbar
member.exception: If the number of buttons exceed the maximum allowed capacity (7).
If the control passed in null
member.remarks: After a toolbar has been added to a thumbnail, buttons can be altered only through various properties on the ThumbnailToolBarButton. While individual buttons cannot be added or removed, they can be shown and hidden through ThumbnailToolBarButton.Visible as needed. The toolbar itself cannot be removed without re-creating the window itself.

member.name: M:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.CoreNativeMethods.PostMessage(System.IntPtr,MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.WindowMessage,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Places (posts) a message in the message queue associated with the thread that created the specified window and returns without waiting for the thread to process the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
member.returns: A return code specific to the message being sent.

member.name: M:MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.CoreNativeMethods.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.WindowMessage,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sends the specified message to a window or windows. The SendMessage function calls the window procedure for the specified window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
member.returns: A return code specific to the message being sent.

member.name: M:GS.Common.Utility.Win32NativeMethods.FindWindows(System.Func{System.Int32,System.Boolean},System.Int32,System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex)
member.summary: The main search function of the WindowFinder class. The parentHandle parameter is optional, taking in a zero if omitted. The className can be null as well, in this case the class name will not be searched. For the window text we can input a Regex object that will be matched to the window text, unless it's null. The process parameter can be null as well, otherwise it'll match on the process name (Internet Explorer = "iexplore"). Finally we take the FoundWindowCallback function that'll be called each time a suitable window has been found.

member.name: M:GS.Common.Utility.Win32NativeMethods.FindWindows(System.Func{System.Int32,System.Boolean},System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The main search function of the WindowFinder class. The parentHandle parameter is optional, taking in a zero if omitted. The className can be null as well, in this case the class name will not be searched. For the window text we can input a Regex object that will be matched to the window text, unless it's null. The process parameter can be null as well, otherwise it'll match on the process name (Internet Explorer = "iexplore"). Finally we take the FoundWindowCallback function that'll be called each time a suitable window has been found.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles
member.summary: Enumeration of the different ways of showing a window using ShowWindow

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.
member.remarks: See SW_HIDE

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.ShowNormal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.
member.remarks: See SW_SHOWNORMAL

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.
member.remarks: See SW_SHOWMINIMIZED

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.
member.remarks: See SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.Maximize
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.
member.remarks: See SW_MAXIMIZE

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.ShowNormalNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to "ShowNormal", except the window is not actived.
member.remarks: See SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.
member.remarks: See SW_SHOW

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.
member.remarks: See SW_MINIMIZE

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.ShowMinNoActivate
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to "ShowMinimized", except the window is not activated.
member.remarks: See SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to "Show", except the window is not activated.
member.remarks: See SW_SHOWNA

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.
member.remarks: See SW_RESTORE

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.
member.remarks: See SW_SHOWDEFAULT

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.WindowShowStyles.ForceMinimized
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is hung. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.
member.remarks: See SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
